errors.unsupportedProposalType: Cannot retrieve quorum for unsupported proposal type {proposalType}
errors.noQuorumForCycle: Cannot retrieve quorum for vote cycle {voteCycle}

howItWorks.title:
Voting process:
how does it work?
howItWorks.description: The voting system consists of two steps. In the first one, you are asked to express your opinion for every each proposal
howItWorks.step1:
First step

At the bottom of each proposals detail you will find 3 buttons to express your opinion
howItWorks.step2:
Second step

From the summary pannel, that you will find at the bottom of your screen, you can use your trust token to validate the vote

step2.title:
Changed your mind?
How to manage your preferances from the summary panel
step2.description: The voting system consists of two steps. In the first one, you are asked to express your opinion for every each proposal

step3.title:
Trust token:
how they work and why you want to use all of them at once
step3.description: The voting system consists of two steps. In the first one, you are asked to express your opinion for every each proposal

description.title: Liquid Seeds
description.explanation: Spread Seeds far and wide as gifts for regeneration. Create a campaign to reward your community or for an action that heals people and our planet.
description.note: Not intended for projects that need to sell Seeds to cover expenses. Campaigns are designed to get Seeds into as many hands as possible.

description.title: Defered Seeds
description.explanation: Earn a share of this movement as an organisation dedicated to helping and healing people, communities and our planet.
description.note: Seeds are held in escrow until after 'Go Live'. Grow the value of your Alliance Share by helping this movement grow.

description.title: SEEDS is self governed by the people who use it!
description.explanation: Referendums allow you to co-create the game and help shape the rules by suggesting evolutions to the Game Guide or Constitution.

image.title: Upload Image
image.description: Proposals with cool images get better reactions!

purpose.label: What is the proposal?
purpose.placeholder: In as few words as possible, tell us what you’d like to change.

howWillServe.label: How will this serve the regenerative movement?
howWillServe.placeholder: How does this campaign serve people and / or our planet?

usage.label: How will these Seeds be used? How do people participate?
usage.placeholder: Get people excited to participate in your campaign

howManyPeople.label: How many people will benefit from this campaign?

whyThisAmount.label: Why are you asking for this amount?
whyThisAmount.placeholder: A single SEED can grow a tree

economics.title: Campaign economics
economics.explanation: According to your community size, you may request up to 250USD worth of Seeds. You can’t change the amout after you submit the proposal
economics.firstProposalTip: This is your first campaign, start small
economics.disclaimer: By clicking here, I understand that Distribution Campaign Seeds are not intended to be sold to pay for project costs

review.title: Review
review.explanation:
Almost Done!
Check out the preview putting yourself in the shoes of someone reading it. Would you vote on it?

Edits will be possible until the proposal goes live at the next cycle.

If your proposal passes and you fail to follow through, your account will lose reputation and won’t be able to apply again.

image.title: Upload Image
image.description: Proposals with better images get better reactions!

howWillServe.label: How will this serve the regenerative movement?
howWillServe.placeholder: Tell us how your organization is regenerative

usage.label: What value are you offering the SEEDS community or the regenerative movement? Why should people support this Alliance
usage.placeholder: Tell us what impact you have or plan to have with this support?

howManyPeople.label: What is the current reach of your regenerative impact?

whyThisAmount.label: Why are you asking for this amount?
whyThisAmount.placeholder: A single SEED can grow a tree

referendum.label: Referendum
referendum.title: Referendum details

name.label: Are you referring to an existing section in the Game Guide or Constitution?
name.placeholder: Reference a section that corresponds with the Contents so it's easy to find.

image.title: Upload Image
image.description: Proposals with better images get better reactions!

whatIsProposal.label: What is the proposal?
whatIsProposal.placeholder: In as few words as possible, tell us what you would like to change.

tensionOrConflict.label: What inspired this proposal or what tension does it aim to resolve?
tensionOrConflict.placeholder: Share with us how this proposal improves the document or solves a tension

expectedResult.label: What do you expect will happen with this change?  What metrics do we look to to know if this change was successful?

downsides.label: Are there any downsides?
downsides.placeholder: Share any potential human, financial or other costs that this change may incur.

review.title: Review
review.explanation:
Almost Done!
Check out the preview putting yourself in the shoes of someone reading it. Would you vote on it?

Edits will be possible until the proposal goes live at the next cycle.

referendum.explanation: Make sure you’re looking at the latest version of the
referendum.note: {amount} SEEDS will be charged for this proposal.

linkADiscussion.title: Link a discussion to this proposal.
linkADiscussion.description: Each proposal must be linked to a discussion in the 'Engage' section. Choose a discussion below.
linkADiscussion.disclaimer: I don't have a discussion for this proposal. Please create one for me.

whyThisAmount.label: Why are you asking for this amount?
whyThisAmount.placeholder: A single Seed can grow a tree

receivingAccount.label: SEEDS account to receive the funds

createOrEdit.explanation: Your stake is returned to you when the proposal is approved. If you happen to be unlucky on this proposal, the stake is cycled back through the community, and we encourage you to keep trying. The stake is 5% of the proposal request and a minimum of 555 Seeds.
createOrEdit.disclaimer: By clicking here, I understand that Distribution Campaign Seeds are not intended to be sold to pay for project costs

chart.title: Stake Seeds

enoughFunds.explanation: At the end, you can decide how you'd like to stake this proposal

notEnoughFunds.note: You don't have enough funds to stake
notEnoughFunds.explanation: You can continue without staking and we will give you some options at the end.

chart.explanation: Your stake is returned to you when the proposal is approved. If you happen to be unlucky on this proposal, the stake is cycled back through the community, and we encourage you to keep trying. The stake is 5% of the proposal request and a minimum of 555 Seeds.

forOther.title: Stake proposal
forOther.explanation: The stake is returned to you when the proposal is approved. If you happen to be unlucky on this proposal, the stake is cycled back through the community, and we encourage you to keep trying

stake.title: Congratulations!
stake.info: Now it’s time to manage the stake. Until then, this proposal will remain in “Upcoming”.

options.title: Your options

fullAmount.title: Stake full amount
fullAmount.description: Awesome! Your proposal will go live automatically at the next cycle.

partialAmount.title: Stake partial amount
partialAmount.description: You can stake a partial amount, but until the entire stake is covered in full, this proposal will remain in “Upcoming.”

dontStake.title: Don’t stake now
dontStake.description: Someone else may stake for you while the proposal is still “Upcoming” where it will remain until the full stake is covered.

options.disclaimer: Your stake is returned when the proposal is approved. If you happen to be unlucky on this proposal, the stake is cycled back through the community, and we encourage you to keep trying.

precast.title: Cast your vote
precast.text: Make sure you read through each proposal and pre-cast your decision. Then, you can use your trust tokens to officially vote, but only after the pre-cast is set.

voted-on.title: Thank you!
voted-on.subtitle: Your Citizen voice is much apreciated!

monitor-scores.title: Monitor the scores
monitor-scores.subtitle: See how the proposals are doing
